sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"看，瞧"之意。
means: gaze ： 指出于羡慕、感兴趣、关心或惊异而长时间目不转睛地看。
glare ： 指用愤恨、凶狠或含敌意的眼光死死看着某人。
stare ： 侧重因惊奇、好奇、粗鲁无礼等而睁大眼睛看。
peer ： 指眯着眼睛仔细地或略为吃力地看。
glance ： 指匆匆地或粗略地一看，侧重心不在焉地、匆忙地看一眼。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: perhaps a variant of dialect pire; perhaps partly from a shortening of appear
Middle English: from Old French peer, from Latin par 'equal'

encyclopedia.content: peer 一种基于eclipse上的插件程序，全称是peer review eclipse plug-in. eclipse是IBM开发的一种软件开发平台，它是一种支持不同编程语言的开发环境，为多种语言编程环境提供了一个平台。还可以在eclipse上面开发好多插件以增强功能，例如prep就是一种：即基于eclipse上的同行评审插件。可以查看词条eclipse和同行评审以更好的理解peer的作用。peer.exe Peer.exe为fs2you网络硬盘生成的文件，当连接到Fs2you网站时，不会引发插件

entry.tran: （通常因难以看清而）盯着看，凝视，端详
entry.def: If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly.

example.ex: I had been peering at a computer print-out that made no sense at all...
example.tran: 我一直盯着看一张毫无意义的计算机打印稿。

example.ex: He watched the Customs official peer into the driver's window.
example.tran: 他看见海关官员透过驾驶座车窗仔细地往里看。

entry.tran: （英国有权或曾经有权在上议院投票的）贵族
entry.def: In Britain, a peer is a member of the nobility who has or had the right to vote in the House of Lords.

example.ex: Lord Swan was made a life peer in 1981.
example.tran: 斯旺勋爵于1981年受封终身贵族。

entry.tran: 同龄人；同辈；身份（或地位）相同的人
entry.def: Your peers are the people who are the same age as you or who have the same status as you.

example.ex: ...children who are much cleverer than their peers...
example.tran: 比同龄人聪明许多的孩子

example.ex: His engaging personality made him popular with his peers.
example.tran: 他迷人的个性使他深受同龄人的喜爱。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
2. a nobleman (duke or marquis or earl or viscount or baron) who is a member of the British peerage

sentences.sentence: "We peered into the back of the shop to see whether a salesman was around"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ap加强+pear看见;出现→看见了→出现了
disappear消失+ance性质→n.不见, 消失 v.与……同等 n.同等的人
peer=pear看见;出现→凝视, 窥视→同等的人→与……同等

Peering into the future G) The sharing economy is a little like online shopping, which started in America 15 years ago
White students tend to look down upon their black peers.

a parent, relative, friend, or doctor outside the family, had higher self-esteem, higher grades, and lower substance use than peers whose role models were sports figures, singers, or other media characters.
Cell phonesfoster social connections with peers across time and space.
Almost all said that their cell phone was the way they stayed in touch with peers, one-third had used the cell phone to help a peer in need, and about 80% said the phone made them feel safer.
